data.title: Allowing to step over before loading a call stack and variables
data.body:
Old issue was closed so I'm opening a new one.
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/22807

Loading call stack and fetching local variables can be a long operations especially when there are a lot of threads started and call stacks are pretty long. Some debuggers (gdb for a example) allows you to do a step over before loading call stack or fetching local variables. Please allow debugger plugin to configure if it's ok to allow to step over before loading call stack and fetching variables.

data.title: Emmet Abbreviation expansion is broken in this release.

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Clean install.  No extensions installed.
2. New html file.
3. Press "!" and TAB.  It merely indents.  
4. Press "!" and hit SHIFT-COMMAND-P, select EMMET: EXPAND ABBREVIATION and it fills out the code as expected.
5. This functionality operates normally in previous version.

data.title: Show a message when we fail to open a directory as link into the editor
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

Whenever I have a url in a file, if it is a website, like https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/new, I can do ctrl+click and it opens in a new tab in the browser. 
Whenever I try to open a file in this manner, with a url like file:///home/matt/, nothing happens. I don't know if this is a bug or opening a file from a url just isn't implemented, but it would be nice if I could do that.

data.title: Save file with slash does not save to folder, but creates file with colon [OSX]

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.2 (6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e, 2017-04-13T07:56:42.517Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.5.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|solidity|JuanBlanco|0.0.22|
|sdlang|LaurentTreguier|0.1.2|
|theme-dark-monokai|bogdan-sinitsa|0.3.0|
|dlang|dlang-vscode|0.9.0|
|Theme-Monokai|gerane|0.0.2|
|ansible|haaaad|0.2.5|
|search-node-modules|jasonnutter|1.0.2|
|prettify-json|mohsen1|0.0.3|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.8.1|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|3.0.1|
|debugger-for-ios-web|msjsdiag|0.1.2|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.5.1|
|code-d|webfreak|0.16.1|
|debug|webfreak|0.18.0|
|jinja|wholroyd|0.0.7|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a new file (CMD+N)
2. Save this file (CMD+S)
3. Specify filename "foo/bar"

Expected:
The file "bar" is saved into folder "foo".
If folder "foo" does not exist, either show an error, or create it.

Actual:
The new file is saved as "foo:bar". OSX Finder shows the file with a slash as "foo/bar", but in VScode (and in `ls`) this shows up as "foo:bar".

Extra:
Since the old days of the Macintosh `:` was used as a path separator and it seems this "magic" is still present in modern day OSX. VScode should detect the slash and do the right thingâ„¢ on all platforms. Sublime editor behaves as expected.

data.title: vscode pylint bug
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.112
- OS Version: ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1.open a python project
2.vscode show you `Error Linter pylint is not installed`
3.then I use the `pip install pylint` and it sucess
4.when I open a python project again, and it show same error massage `Error Linter pylint is not installed`
5.ok, install the pylint again, and it show`Requirement already satisfied`
6.reboot the system and open a python project again, also the same `Error Linter pylint is not installed`

I think it's a vscode bug, THX for developer to fix this problem

data.title: Feature request: setting to make ctrl+tab switch tabs sequentially
data.body:
It would be nice if there was a setting to switch ctrl+tab and ctrl+shift+tab behavior to cycle through tabs in a sequential left-to-right/right-to-left order rather than in most-recently-used order.

If this can be achieved by changing keybindings than feel free to close this, but I didn't see anything in a brief search of the keybindings page.

data.title: "LXSS" section dedicated in plugin configuration files
data.body:
Currently I am trying to use GCC, Clang and cmake with the Windows subsystem for Linux. In it, for the existing Config file getting generated for each section has 3 sections namely win32, macos and linux.

I would like there to be a default section dedicated for LXSS so that the vanilla relative path for library and header path always start from the **%APPDATA%\..\Local\Lxss** location.

data.title: Route emmet actions to extension
data.body:
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-emmet is the new Emmet extension that has implemented 5 of the various emmet related builtin actions.

This PR is to route these 5 actions to the extension, if the user has the extension installed and the setting `emmet.overrideBuiltinActions` enabled (which is enabled by default once extension is installed)

data.title: Mac Close File Confirm Dialog Does not Prevent Workbench Keyboard Actions From Being Queued
data.body:
MacOs 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. On MacOS, try to use cmd + w to close a dirty file
2. Wait for the file close dialog to come up
3. With the dialog showing, try pressing cmd + w again or cmd + f
4. Press cancel

**Expected**
These actions are ignored

**Actual**
The actions for the keybindings seem to be queued up and executed when the dialog is closed.

![apr-27-2017 16-34-13](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/25508556/af2285f0-2b67-11e7-90b4-1d85b3570ff2.gif)


This can result in the close confirmation dialog immediately showing again if you press cmd + w multiple times by mistake.

data.title: CSS Color Preview is The Wrong Color on High Contrast Theme With Color Customizations
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version:
- OS Version:

Steps to Reproduce:

```
    "workbench.colorCustomizations": {
        "editorLineHighlight": "#ff00ff",
	"editorBackground": "#ffff00"
    },
    "workbench.colorTheme": "Default High Contrast"
```


**Bug**
Notice that the css previews are now the wrong colors. The top one should be pink while the bottom one should be yellow. Both `editorLineHighlight` and `editorBackground` seem to alter the colors

![apr-27-2017 15-14-19](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/25506646/86eef632-2b5c-11e7-9ac8-32cdfee42aa6.gif)

data.title: Scalability issues in Problems panel

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.12.0-insider (d8a1d8b8a7c886547ba6bc0d81fc2ff639d4c9f5, 2017-04-27T06:05:48.177Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.5.0

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install extension from https://github.com/kieferrm/vscode-22804 (preferred) or clone repo, open folder, and <kbd>F5</kdb>
2. Run **Crazy: Flood Problems View with Files** from Command Palette
3. Accept defaults (i.e. 10000 files and 2 errors per file)
-> generation of errors blocks UI for around 5-10s (unpleasant but borderline acceptable)
4. Press **Collapse All** button in Problems panel
-> UI is blocked for a long time; I get 2-3 **Window is not responding** pop-ups (major)

A small number of errors on a large number of files is a situation that can easily happen with compiled languages in a misconfigured larger project.

data.title: Typo in source string - vs_workbench_parts_files
data.body:
Context:
src/vs/workbench/parts/files/browser/files.contribution:English (en):plaintext:hotExit.onExitAndWindowClose
Resource:
vs_workbench_parts_files

Typo of Palette :
Hot exit will be triggered when the application is closed, that is when the last window is closed on Windows/Linux or when the workbench.action.quit command is triggered (command pallete, keybinding, menu)

Reported by by joelyang, Thanks joelyang.
https://www.transifex.com/microsoft-oss/vscode-workbench/translate/#zh-Hans/$/111041964?issue=yes

data.title: The ordinal 345 could not be located in the dynamic link library

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
As of the last two (or three?) updates, I'm receiving the following error when trying to launch VS Code Insiders.
```
The ordinal 345 could not be located in the dynamic link library C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders\code - insiders.exe
```

The only error recorded in the windows event logs was an `Application popup` log entry in the `System` logs. It simply contained a copy of the message - no further information.
Are there logs recorded anywhere that I can post for assistance?

I've searched everywhere and the only references I can find relate to multiple ComCtl32.dll versions in windows xp. (e.g.: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/37016803/calling-taskdialogindirect-loader-says-ordinal-345-not-found)

- VSCode Version: 1.12.0.insider (2017-04-27T06:12:15.095Z)
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro v10.0.14393

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Launch `Code - insiders.exe` <- throws error.
2. Launch `Code - insiders.exe` a second time <- runs ok.

Repeat this process over and over with same result every second time.

![2017-04-28](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/355130/25504562/ac4e99de-2be1-11e7-81dc-f7789a0e9aaa.png)

![2017-04-28 1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/355130/25504568/b277e040-2be1-11e7-8abe-afabc892064c.png)
